website_summaries.verdict: Popular choice for kids coloring as a non-toxic formula featuring brilliant colors.
pros: Vivid, blendable colors with soft laydown and fade-resistant pigment
Extensive color range that is decently organized in two-layer box
cons: Quality and pigment aren't on par with artist-grade colored pencils

customer_reviews.title: A traditional school colored pencil at a very good price
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for top-notch colored pencils at a "middle-school" price, you can do a lot worse than these Prangs in the box of 50, which costs only a couple of dollars more than the box of 24. About the only criticism I can think of is that the range of color in this book shows a tendency toward earth-tones. But then, the candy or neon colors are the province of the primary grades!
customer_reviews.author: Allen SmallingTop Contributor: Classical Music

customer_reviews.title: Colors are not labeled!
customer_reviews.text: The colors are not labeled. It's pretty much guess work to find a particular color. Some look like it'd be one color but turns out to be another. I would give this 0 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Great colored pencils
customer_reviews.text: I have never been a colored pencil fan. But since I started doing hand lettering, I figured I should buy some. I decided to buy these and I must say I am impressed. Here are some pros and cons: Pros: Vivid colors Easy to blend Minimal pressure needed Color names on pencil in 3 languages Cons: Points have broken when slightly pressed on paper Cardboard packaging
customer_reviews.author: JayCast

customer_reviews.title: Good until sharpening ... leads mostly broken
customer_reviews.text: I just got used to what colors I like in this set (the color names aren't exactly 'spot on') and now that I'm needing to sharpen them, most of the leads are broken so each time I sharpen and start to use, the end falls out. I'm pretty disappointed but for the price I can't complain too much. I was just dabbling around with the designed, more "grown up" coloring books on Amazon so now that I know that I like doing that, I will look for a better set.
customer_reviews.author: 10CatMom+

customer_reviews.title: It's all about the colors
customer_reviews.text: It's okay, its not "Prismacolor or Castle Art " pencils but it colors. Because of a review I thought I would check it out. I do use the pencils for coloring books that need details. But every once in a while if the color doesn't come out the way I want it to, I end up going back to the best. The texture is not as smooth but its good enough. If you don't have "Prismacolor" etc. pencils which is a bit costly if you go for the bigger set you will find this just fine until you get into really coloring and realize you want more colors and more quality than this is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: JazziTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: You have to put some strength to make the color bright, otherwise it's just very light color.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Z

customer_reviews.title: These are pro. Prang just thinks pro should be affordable.
customer_reviews.text: I've used these pencils since my art teacher recommended them 30 years ago. Back then you could only get them from an art supply store, they are pro quality pencils. My children grew up with Prang color pencils and crayons instead of Crayola because they are affordable and give amazing results. Far superior to anything else in their price range. Very smooth, rich color. Better than most other "professional" brands.
customer_reviews.author: Llenae

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful quality pencils for an unbeatable price.
customer_reviews.text: They’re very nice pencils they work great and the price is unbeatable. The packaging is also adorable. When gifting them with an adult coloring book we were hoping not to buy from a very name brand pencil company because we didn’t want the gift to look cheap and we wanted to show some thought, love and effort went into the gift. So not any pencils would do. These satisfied our needs completely. The packaging is very mature and not at all childish.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Really good for coloring
customer_reviews.text: Most pencils were just fine for coloring. Wouldn't necessarily recommend as an artist set, but there is generally sufficient color variety and quality is good. Some pencils lay very nice dense colors while some others are pretty "hard". Would highly recommend for kids and grown-ups who just like to have a bit of down time though!
customer_reviews.author: Mickey B

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price - read review
customer_reviews.text: Work okay, but the color(lead?) breaks easily and they don’t have names so if you wanted to use the same color as something else or continue an unfinished project you have to test and compare. Lastly, the outside color doesn’t mean the color(lead?) will match. For example a lighter red color has a dark purple outside.... OTHERWISE, they work well and good for a young child who won’t care too much about those things... good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Just go to Walmart and buy Cra-Z-Art! These are not good pencils. The colors are dull and very hard to tell so many of them apart: greens, grey, purples! I will never buy again. I would return if I hadn't ripped up the package to put them in a mug to sit on my craft cart before actually using.
customer_reviews.author: Tresa

customer_reviews.title: Don’t.
customer_reviews.text: These pencils are ok in quality for the price, but I have some complaints. Number one- a lot of the colors are the same. They may have different colors on the outside but they’re the exact same. A lot of the colors have an almost black look on the outside and literally none of them are black, and they aren’t labeled so even if you found a color you liked, good luck remembering which one it is, so no, I do not recommend and I wish I had spent more money on another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Gassiott

customer_reviews.title: I finally have "my colored pencils"
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a bunch of Prismacolor pencils then my daughter decided to lose them all on me I wasn't about to pay top dollar for something like that again so I did some research on the best colored pencil's out there and this one was in the top three. I'm an artist my husband didn't mind me spending more money because he wanted me to have the best but I'm very happy with this product and extremely happy with the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Liv4Hymn

customer_reviews.title: Prang remains high quality
customer_reviews.text: I love that they put tape on the sides of the box so that the color pencils stayed in tact and didn’t get jumbled in the box. Most of these pencils do color with the quality I see in my Prismacolor premiers. Some are a little less creamy but that’s ok. I love these! They definitely are a product from my childhood and great to find such a gem on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Paper Princess

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed👍
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for budget priced pencils. They blend and layer well, and I have no problems with sharpening them. They go down smoothly, but not so smooth where the tip wears down too soon (like prismacolor). I had an enjoyable coloring experience with these Prang colored pencils. Great for adults who are starting back in coloring books. I will continue to use these.
customer_reviews.author: Sapphire

customer_reviews.title: Pencils break when sharpened
customer_reviews.text: Pencils color smoothly and blend reasonably for a budget set, but have no names or numbers on the pencils. And several of the pencils break when sharpened. This is most noticeable in the greens. Also, there appear to be several duplicate pencils with identical lead color, but different paint on the outside of the pencil. I won't be ordering Prang 72 count again.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Pahmeier

customer_reviews.title: So underrated and the best for your money
customer_reviews.text: I have seen several videos of these pencils in action. For coloring or really any art, these are the best at blending and smooth lines. In the picture, only the lighter blue blob on top is Prang, but you can tell vs the rest it is just better quality with no fall out when swatched. The liquidmark is probably the closest to prang for smoothness. Really like the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lange

customer_reviews.title: Moving on to better Quality..No More Crazy Art
customer_reviews.text: So I have upgraded my colored pencils from crazy art to prang, pentel, and sergeant. I definitely do not regret it. I have gotten very use to the waxy crazy art, and I am learning all over again. There is DEFINITELY a big difference in quality! I can now begin practice the techniques I want to learn and experience. You are limited in color variety, so I bought prang, pentel and sergeant and I am still short in greys, pinks and reds. Overall I am feeling good about my purchase. I also bought Prang glitter markers, don't bother. Crayola works so much better for the price. The prang glitter markers have hardly any glitter.
customer_reviews.author: TeresaTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: They've replaced our crayons and markers!
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long!! With 2 little kids, we bought into the crayola scheme of crayons and markets, which meant mess and mess. We were preparing for a long trip abroad with the kids and decided to buy colored pencils (and a sharpener of course) so we'd have more colors, and try out the idea of less mess. Man these are great!!! So many colors, and easy to use for the kids! What I mean is that they sharpened very easily without breaking, and the kids didnt really break the tips when drawing. This considering one is 4 and one is 2 years old. These are so great, we've done away with crayons and markers!
customer_reviews.author: Goldie

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my daughter's virtual 3 grade class. She loves them, and I do too! They are not the kind that snap with the slightest of pressure, they color great, and are easy to grip, even for her little hands. Even my 1st grader loves them. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Nick D.

customer_reviews.title: Pencil colors not labeled & Pencil color doesn’t always match lead color.
customer_reviews.text: I’m disappointed the pencils are not labeled like my other set of Prang pencils. What is even more frustrating is that the colors of the pencils don’t always match the pencil lead. It’s a bunch of guess work to figure out if alive got the particular color I want.
customer_reviews.author: M. Iddings

customer_reviews.title: Pencil Split In Two the First Day I Got the Set
customer_reviews.text: Pencil cracked from the tip to the end, the first time I sharpened it. I noticed other pencils in the set look like they are ready to split as well. The wood in these pencils is not good quality material, you can see the line where it is glued together - the same place the pencil I sharpened cracked, and some of the wood halves are of separate colors and consistency. Very disappointing, especially since I found the pencils' colors to be smooth, vivid, and easy to apply - very lovely and a great selection of hues. But, I cannot use the pencil after it has split in two.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy A. Pippig

customer_reviews.title: Package in terrible shape, pencils fine.
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived beat to hell. I bought these as a gift to give a friend and I'm so embarrassed to send this to her but I don't have time to replace them. The pencils themselves are fine but the box looks like it was pulled from the hands of a 3 year old before being shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Prangs are more of a midgrade quality pencil.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my mom because the reviews said they stood up to more expensive brands such as prismacolor. I have to disagree, I have both prismacolor scholar and prismacolor premiere pencils and they both outperform the prang pencils significantly, granted I like a softer pencil lead so that could be part of my issue because these have a core more similar to the hardness of prismacolor verithin pencils. I would say these fall between crayola quality and prismacolor verithins (in fact my mom said that with come colors, the crayola pencils had a better saturation of color than the prang pencils.)
customer_reviews.author: Aero

customer_reviews.title: Way too hard
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 12 count to try them. I used these in an adult coloring book on amazon paper. They get a star for being inexpensive and for sharpening without breaking. Other than that... not worth it. Colors are weak - not vivid, made my hand sore just trying to get color down, and don't blend or layer well at all. Crayola kids pencils are better. These will go to my neighbor's Sunday School class.
customer_reviews.author: Deb WTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: 50 Coloring Pencils
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews on this product, I decided to get the more expensive 50 coloring pencil as opposed to the 72. I'm happy with my purchase. The pencils are pretty good quality and have been serving their purpose. I like the thick core.
customer_reviews.author: Vikki Y

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I made a color sample sheet, and many colors are VERY similar: Pumpkin, Orange and Yellow Orange for example come up almost the same on my sample sheet. The same thing happened with some of the Reds. The Blues and Greens are better, but the names don't really match the lead color--Dark Blue is lighter than Blue. This will be a back-up set for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kabbie

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...cheap quality.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! I really should have splurged for the nicer ones, and I will. When I opened the set, and started pulling them out, I found one was split all the way down the center, and another had about 2" broken off completely. I scribbled a bit with a couple of them to see if they were worth keeping and not only did they have an odd smell, they were not very vivid and felt rough on the paper. Maybe I got a bad batch, but I am definitely going to pick up the Prismacolors next time.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. Kinard

customer_reviews.title: Allows You To Draw Daily
customer_reviews.text: This set has a wide range of colors and will allow you to practice your drawing and coloring a lot more than expensive brands- whatever shortcomings this set has by comparison- you'll get a lot of use out of it and the more practice you have the better technique you'll get. You aren't tied to one set of pencils so you can practice with these for sketching and filling space til your idea is solid then use the medium you're most comfortable with for your final art piece. Very useful to have around.
customer_reviews.author: thirdtwin

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth, bright colors, fun to use these colored pencils!
customer_reviews.text: I just started getting into the 'adult coloring book' thing and picked these as my first set of pencils - good reviews and a nice, low price for a good amount of pencils. So far I'm happy with them- I've spent a few hours coloring and the pencils are very smooth, nice colors, and don't get dull too quickly. My three year old son has also borrowed them a few times and he enjoys them as well. They are very easy to use when coloring intricate patterns and small designs. I think they will last me a while, but when I need new ones I will definitely get this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Kris G.

customer_reviews.title: Most importantly, the colors don't always match what they're supposed to be.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they were cheap. That was a mistake. Have a piece of scratch paper out because you'll want to test the colors before you use them! Many of the leads are different colors than the pencil shows.
customer_reviews.author: MeganAllie

customer_reviews.title: Colors Are Not As Distinct
customer_reviews.text: This is OK for the price. The pencils do not glide as smoothly as I would want them to; probably because the texture is too waxy. They feel "heavy". Some of the colors are not distinct. For example, the Orange and the Yellow Orange look almost the same. I also don't see much difference between the Magenta and the Purple; or between the Harvest Yellow and the Golden Yellow. The Dark Blue isn't any darker than the Blue; and the Dark Green is actually lighter than the Green! The Olive Green has too much yellow pigments in it. There are 4 Neon colors, which are nice. These are almost comparable to the Crayola Extreme Ultra-Bright.
customer_reviews.author: G. Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Great pencils, a mess in the box! Get new container.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving 4 stars because these are amazing map pencils but they were a mess all over the box. Not organized at all. It was a gift so I tried to make it presentable but I couldn't get them to fit right.
customer_reviews.author: Niels Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly imperfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand, very bold & smooth. <EDITED - after using a few times> When I go to sharpen these the color leads are breaking off due to being broken inside the wood pencil. Most of these have broken halfway down or more! Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: KDickey

customer_reviews.title: high hopes turned low
customer_reviews.text: The pigment on these is great for the most part. Some lead is smoother than others lending to some of the pencils in the box being better than others. At first I loved these but once I started sharpening them, not so much. Almost all of them at some point were broken. Not the wood but the lead so as I'm sharpening the lead would fall out. One blue one I actually had to sharpening 3inches before the lead stopped falling out. Very disappointed when they aren't that much better than dollar store pencils.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn R.

customer_reviews.title: Special brand of colored pencils the 72 count package I just received
customer_reviews.text: received my 72 count pencil package and the box for the pencils was ripped had to tape it back together to hold the pencils and they were falling out cause the box was opened in the envelope they came in. Luckily all 72 pencils were accounted for. They should have been packed better than they were.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Wachowiak

customer_reviews.title: These colored pencils do not blend but for the price I am glad I purchased them.
customer_reviews.text: I wish these pencils would blend! My granddaughter loves them but I needed colors that matched the colors available in Family Tree Maker for color-coding my family tree. If these blended better these would work for my genealogy project.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Ware

customer_reviews.title: These map pencils are great...don't pass up
customer_reviews.text: The colors are so vivid...I'm glad I purchased these colored pencils.The only problem I have is it's difficult to see the colors without taking them out of the packaging be better... Like a slide-out tray..other than that I really love the color...will buy again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa T Leal

customer_reviews.title: They don't blend too well in my opinion and they just don't have that nice, smooth feeling like some other pencils have
customer_reviews.text: I must admit that I had really high hopes for these pencils based on what I had heard from a couple of my friends who had them. But once I received them I wasn't really too impressed. They don't blend too well in my opinion and they just don't have that nice, smooth feeling like some other pencils have. The colors are decently pigmented and the pencils themselves feel odd in my hand because they are a larger diameter than all of the other pencils I have used. Overall these are decent pencils and a step above say Cra-Z-Art or Crayola but definitely not the best.
customer_reviews.author: Krystle H

customer_reviews.title: Nice if you know your colors!
customer_reviews.text: So I've been using Prang exclusively for many a year and have loved their products but recently I bought the 72 pack of pencils and I'm very disappointed they don't label each pencil with any name so your guess of color is just trial and error. Somewhat a shame!
customer_reviews.author: Kritterfox

customer_reviews.title: More like a crayon
customer_reviews.text: The variety of colors is nice, but the pencils cover more like a crayon, especially if you're using them for shading. Good price though. I find RoseArt pencils cover much better, and they're still inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap pencils
customer_reviews.text: For cheap cheap pencils these are a great buy. They lay down great color and you get a good choice of colors in the 50 package. Names of colors are on the pencils which is always a plus. Color is smooth and covers well. If you are looking for an everyday pencil for those quickie projects in the less expensive books and don't want to use your expensive pencils, these will do the trick and you'll get great results.
customer_reviews.author: Debra G. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: good colors; good price
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these with adult coloring pages. The colors are more vibrant than my Staedtler Noris Club pencils and I like having the variety of subtle and brighter colors to choose from. The color goes on smoothly. They're a bit thicker than a regular pencil and my electric pencil sharpener wants to grab them and not let go. So there is some scraping on the side of the pencils when they're sharpened. The last time I sharpened them I used a hand sharpener which worked okay but there was a little breakage when sharpening a couple of the pencils (both electric and hand sharpener). For the price and the color selection I'm satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Inexpensive Pencils
customer_reviews.text: In my humble opinion, Prang is the best of the inexpensive colored pencils. I've bought numerous other boxes of colored pencils and Prang absolutely outshines them all. The leads are nice and soft which means you can lay down some beautiful deep colors. The Prang red is the best of all my reds. I've already bought a second box as a back-up for when some of my favorite colors get used up and whenever I give a coloring book and colored pencils as a gift I always order the Prang box from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: LindaLouise6517

customer_reviews.title: Prang Thick Core 50 Pencils set
customer_reviews.text: Prang Thick Core 50 Pencils set *Inexpensive *Great quality set for all ages young & old. *50 beautiful vibrant colors. Great for exploring colors. * Come pre-sharpened. Sharpen easily with hand sharpener. *High quality lead not to soft, or to hard. * Draw, color, shade, and blend so much easier than competitor brands. *An essential for anyone who likes to draw/color, schools & home-schools art supplement. I will definitely purchase these again when I need to replenish them.
customer_reviews.author: Gracelynn May

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: I am familiar with this product and highly recommend it. There are lots of colored pencils out there costing lots more that don't do any better. Get them!
customer_reviews.author: Akinmt

customer_reviews.title: Good color pencils, but not that durable.
customer_reviews.text: The range of colors available is impressive. The colors are pretty bright, and the lead seems sturdy so far (it's been about 2 weeks now). The only drawback is the box, which doesn't seem to hold the pencils very well. We have much difficulties putting the pencils back neatly each time after we're done using them. I would have to look for a separate case just to store the pencils. Update: More than a year later, time proved that the pencil leads are actually pretty fragile, and couldn't take much sharpening. It seems that every time the pencil is sharpened, about 3 inches of it is gone.
customer_reviews.author: Practical Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my boyfriend for Christmas. He is very pleased with them! The colors are vibrant and the pigment is smooth on the page. I expect these will get a lot of use in our house and we will likely purchase this brand again. I have a mismatched set of Prismacolors from years ago that I now regret spending so much money on. In my opinion, these Prang pencils are *almost* just as good for less than half the price.
customer_reviews.author: oneladyeagle

customer_reviews.title: Good Colored Pencils
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the Crayola colored pencils and the don't cost much more. Actually, since the Crayola pencils just snap off, break, and splinter when we try to sharpen them, these ended up being a much better value. My 5 year old and I love to use them to do color by number. They were great for that purpose. We also use them for writing and doing puzzles and mazes. They make a bold and clear line and are perfect for our purposes. No idea how they would be for real art, but I'd probably go with something higher end for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: High quality, low price, great deal
customer_reviews.text: Prang is a great colored pencil and the price can’t be beat. I bought a bunch to put in gifts to vets and children for Christmas. It feels good to give them something of high quality as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn J.

customer_reviews.title: Good for coloring. Arrived in sloppy packaging with broken leads.
customer_reviews.text: Pencils are okay for casual coloring. I'm not sure an artist would like them as they are slightly waxy. Would have given 4 stars but they Arrived in sloppy packaging with some broken leads. Photos show how they arrived. Also show the colors of some of the pencils. Overall I'm happy with the purchase but wish more care had gone into the packaging of them for shipment.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzi - Florida

customer_reviews.title: Received damage box
customer_reviews.text: Received a damaged box that I was surprised they were even still in the box. But had to remove for storage. One of my fave pencils though.
customer_reviews.author: KipKip

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to use with a drawing book for my daughter. I used to use Dixon Colorarts as a child and they were excellent colored pencils. Knowing that Prang acquired that company, I assumed that these would be of similar quality but they are not. The lead is hard and brittle and does not deliver a vibrant color. The texture is scratchy and rough, not the smooth glide one wishes for in quality art supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Diva

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: Prang is becoming increasingly harder to find in stores. I prefer it over any other brand because the colors are the most vivid and bright. The quality is far superior to Crayola and RoseArt. This product has an unbeatable price here and you don’t have to search around to find it. These are great pencils.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Quality doesn't always cost a fortune!
customer_reviews.text: I try to get my kids really good quality art supplies because it's frustrating to use crummy art stuff. I want them to enjoy the feel of brushes and pencils against the page and not having stuff falling apart while they use it. But nice colored pencils can be SO expensive and kids can be rough on them. Prang makes GREAT stuff for GREAT prices. I go out of my way to buy their stuff - even for my grownup self. These pencils have great pigment and aren't too hard or too soft - just right.
customer_reviews.author: AK Lore

customer_reviews.title: Great color variety and quality
customer_reviews.text: These colored pencils are the best value for the money. I get great color pay off from these. I like to do intricate coloring, which is how I discovered them. It's a great variety and the colors are vibrant. I sent a set to my mother as well as a couple books and she commented how much she liked these pencils over any others she has tried. I suggest purchasing a storage box for these, as the packaging is just a cardboard box and it's easier to see and grab the color you want. Simply a fantastic value.
customer_reviews.author: PDX Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic and Affordable!
customer_reviews.text: These color pencils definitely do the job! They hold their point, color fairly evenly, can be layered, and are pigmented. I greatly prefer these over Crayola if I'm totally honest. They're great for their price point, but my only wish is that there were more color variety available.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lavelle

customer_reviews.title: Great pencils
customer_reviews.text: Since we're locked down, I decided to try my hand at coloring again -it always relaxes me. These pencils were just the thing.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: I loved using them and was hooked
customer_reviews.text: They leave a lot of residue and are streaky . I got started with an order from one of those (Helen Carter?) catalogs and the book itself had too many overly simple pages. I loved using them and was hooked. That set came with 6 double ended pencils with no brand name. They had three flat sides. Too bad their pencils didn't have a brand name, as they left no residue and were very even. This batch had so many great colors, but I much prefer the coverage and look of those unknown original pencils.
customer_reviews.author: allergy girl

customer_reviews.title: Great color pencil set.
customer_reviews.text: It came sharpened, kids like this set a lot. We have lots of colors to play with!
customer_reviews.author: Tools. Electro. DIY

customer_reviews.title: My long time favorites
customer_reviews.text: These have always been my favorite colored pencils. The leads seem a little thicker and they go on smooth. The last few sets I have purchased seem to not be made quite as well as those purchased several years ago. These make a great starter set and for the price you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Mystery momTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great pencils. I use different typs for my coloring and shading and these work well for what I do. Can’t find them in stores so I had to look them up to get this brand. Thank you I love them
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: my 12 year old niece fell in love with the pencils
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been designing/drawing since she was 8 (she is now 14). She grew out of the cheap Crayola and Rose Art type pencils and now asks for Prang. She was introduced to these pencils two years ago by her art teacher. She takes them many places and lets her younger cousins draw with her...my 12 year old niece fell in love with the pencils, so I ordered her a set for Christmas. Great product....just wish they had a few flesh tone pencils - my daughter runs out of those colors quickly.
customer_reviews.author: TheFam

customer_reviews.title: Better than crayons
customer_reviews.text: Kids and husband color during Quarantine or while I'm preparing dinner. These were a hit after Crayola wasn't doing best job.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous female

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the cheap price fool you! Best budget colored pencils on the market
customer_reviews.text: PROS: * Truly excellent, vibrant colors with a nice range of values * Like Ticonderoga's graphite pencils, strong wood case that doesn't easily break * Overall, best elementary student-grade / budget colored pencil on the market — easily better than Crayola or Melissa & Doug (if not Prismacolor or artist-grade / higher-end pencils) CONS: * Color range is rather limited compared to Crayola or classroom brands
customer_reviews.author: The Smiths

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: Somebody recommended these but they are not as vibrant as crayola brand. Not smooth coloring, have to press hard to get color you want. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, decent color.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, bright colors, shaves well in a regular pencil sharpener, as well as one designed for colored pencils. Every pencil is a different color, unlike a lot of the competitions packs that promise a huge number of pencils but deliver two of each color. I do find that I have to press fairly hard to get the true color out of some of the pencils, so I wouldn't think these would be good for shading or professional art - but they do just fine for meditative coloring of "adult" coloring books.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barron

customer_reviews.title: Lovely
customer_reviews.text: Simply perfect. No having to sharpen these to the nub. The colors are solid and beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Giovonni10

customer_reviews.title: Not labeled
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the money. But if you or the person you’re gifting is a meticulous person these will drive them crazy because the colors are not labeled. Not a big deal if you don’t care. But if you do... there’s a lot of colors and none of them are labeled on the pencils.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as part of a gift for my granddaughter. She seemed very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Ducelick

customer_reviews.title: I like these better than the Crayolas
customer_reviews.text: I like these colored pencils. The leads are harder than the Crayolas and seem to hold their points longer. As a bonus, the leads are somewhat transparent, so you can actually use them as highlighter pencils. I keep a notebook with all the things I have to do every day. I mark it up with these pencils instead of highlighters, which I find bleed right through the pages. Nice pencils.
customer_reviews.author: mls

customer_reviews.title: I wish the box was sturdier
customer_reviews.text: I like these pencils, great colors in this set. Glad I bought them, they've helped me add new dimension to my sketches.
customer_reviews.author: P H

customer_reviews.title: I received these pencils and must say I am terribly disappointed. While they seem easy to get a ...
customer_reviews.text: I received these pencils and must say I am terribly disappointed. While they seem easy to get a good color laydown with, that is when core will stay in the woodcase. The set I received break and lose about 1/4" or slightly more of the pencil core repeatedly. Thus the 1 star rating, I would probably give them a 5 for color laydown/intensity if the core wasn't falling out making a majority of the set impossible to use. Possibly a shipping/handling problem.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Not Ment For Mandalas
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving the rating 2 starts. The two positive things I can say is that the color is smooth and the price was good. The negatives are they are not good for coloring in mandalas, the pencil led sheds when you color and if you don't shake them off after each thing you color in, the led will smear from your hand moving while you color.
customer_reviews.author: SummerSmoke

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: To be cheaper coloring pencils there not bad and they do better job then I thought they would. I would say they are a grade up from crayola coloring pencils.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love these penciles . Great colors , bought two sets for my twin grandchildren who are always sketching.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Vieira

customer_reviews.title: Much better than crayola
customer_reviews.text: Colors nicely, sharpens well. Purchased for my son for school .
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Sciria

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Colored Pencils
customer_reviews.text: These pencils are wonderful. I have always colored with Crayola pencils and these are very smooth like the Crayola pencils are. These do not have soft lead (the kind that bends), which I like a lot. The variety of colors are very good and there are many shades in the same color family that blend well together for ombre-type coloring/shading. I recommend these to anyone looking for a good coloring pencil.
customer_reviews.author: ErikaC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 5 yr old who loves to color. She was very happy to get them.
customer_reviews.author: NJGiGi

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased with these pencils.
customer_reviews.text: Great shades and they flow nicely. They are smooth to use and come in some interesting colors. They are one of the better lower priced pencils. They sharpened very easily without breaking the tips. I use these for adult coloring books and I'm very pleased with these pencils. At this price I highly recommend these. I bought some for a gift and bought some for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Kristal

customer_reviews.title: All the colors of the spectrum!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't believe I'll dislike a thing. They appear to be good sturdy pencils!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The packing is very cheap and the color pencils came broke from the tip. Once you sharpen them, the don’t last.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Liked but not very many shades to chose from! I love using them though!
customer_reviews.author: Kaleigh Baisden

customer_reviews.title: Iffy
customer_reviews.text: I loved all of the colors but it seemed that if I put any pressure on them to make the color darker on a picture, it would break. When trying to sharpen it with a prisma colored pencil sharpener it would constantly rebreak. Definitely sad that they are not great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Boxing Issue
customer_reviews.text: Lots of nice colors for the price but disappointing to see how I received the box. It was completely ripped open in the back and looks like someone tried to fix it with a piece of tape, which did not hold up. The pencils fell out so I had to spend extra to get a case.
customer_reviews.author: SwimGirl02

customer_reviews.title: Good School Supplies
customer_reviews.text: Good school supplies and good quality product is as described.
customer_reviews.author: Scott McCleary

customer_reviews.title: These are superb
customer_reviews.text: Great price! They are higher price normally other places. Great pencils they are bright and easy and smooth. Great for kids or adults
customer_reviews.author: CO

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable pencils
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of these pencils given I hadn't heard of the brand prior to purchasing them. The are smooth and sturdy and have very nice color. Great alternative to the big name brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Missing pencils
customer_reviews.text: had 10 pencils missing so only have complete sets for 20 students and not 24. Cannot be totally surprised given this is a damage box but I was hoping it was complete. will keep
customer_reviews.author: S. Green

customer_reviews.title: Happy!
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time deciding on which colored pencils to buy. Im very happy with my choice. They sharpen up easy and dont crack. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: SunshineDay44

customer_reviews.title: I prefer my Crayola's
customer_reviews.text: I thought these would be awesome colored pencils and wanted an "artist quality" but honestly- I'd rather (and I do) use my Crayola colored pencils!! I get a smoother effect with Crayola that I do with these and for a fraction of the price. I will not be buying them again, I will be letting my kids use them.
customer_reviews.author: Kathan1

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the quality of the pencils. They're smoother than I remember Crayola ones being, which makes coloring a much more enjoyable experience. I use these with the Between the Lines coloring book by Peter Deligdisch and am really happy with the color selection. You get more greens than any other color, but I don't really feel like the color selection is lopsided - the greens are all different from each other and some have a blue-ish tinge. I haven't yet come across a situation in which I didn't have a color I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey D.

customer_reviews.title: Received damaged. Several broken pencil points and box was ripped up.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I’m happy with the color selection but I’m new to coloring
customer_reviews.author: Hedy

customer_reviews.title: break too easily
customer_reviews.text: Although these pencils put down pretty good color they are hard to get a good tip on them when you sharpen them and also break repeatedly while sharpening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased how nice the lay down. 1st Prang product will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Anne Theriault

customer_reviews.title: ... were purchased to replace pencils that he did not like, complaining that they were not soft enough to ...
customer_reviews.text: These are for my fourth grader and were purchased to replace pencils that he did not like, complaining that they were not soft enough to draw with. These pencils seem to have solved that problem. They are softer and easy to color and draw with. His only complaint with these pencils is that some of the colors Are not vivid. For example, the red is a bit pinkish and the light green is too yellow.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Jones

customer_reviews.title: Warning: cheaper brands will not satisfy if you use this once!
customer_reviews.text: Love Prang simply the best. More color less wax hard to go back to the supermarket brands!
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Not to happy with these colors
customer_reviews.text: Not to happy with these colors, the pencils say a color is different but it is all the same colors with different names and you have to press hard or go over several times which in turn tears the paper. I really think if you want a color that gets the job done the first time do not buy these. My arthritis screamed at me for days after using these. Would recommend another type if you are like me with arthritis.
customer_reviews.author: Candy Urrusuno

customer_reviews.title: A gift
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has about 7 different high quality colored pencil sets. After getting my first adult coloring book and borrowing her collection these are my favorite. Probably the cheapest in her montage of pencils and they glide on the paper. When purchasing a color book for my sister there was no guessingwhat pencils to buy. These were the pencils going with the gift!
customer_reviews.author: Silverarm

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Colors
customer_reviews.text: I'm enjoying coloring with these pencils as they sharpen easily without breaking. They blend well, having a good amount of pigment to binder. The metallic colors aren't all that, but then that's not unusual for any kind of metallics. I'm glad there were just gold and silver. Overall, good pencils for drawing or coloring.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Henley Babb

product_meta.title: PRANG Thick Core Colored Pencils, 3.3 Millimeter Cores, 7" Length, Assorted Colors, 72 Count (22725)
product_meta.description: Size:72 CountSince 1882 PRANG Art & Craft solutions maintained an uncompromised quality to ignite the passion of our valued creative customers. With a delicate, rich 3.3mm core guarded by real wood you will experience an unmatched smoothness in the laydown. While the intense pigments will bring your ideas and dreams to life in vivid colors easier to mix so you can create unique shades that reflect your ambitions! They are conveniently pre-sharpened, so they are ready to use right out of the box. AP certified non-toxic.
feature_bullets: Smooth core delivers vivid, blend-able colors and soft laydown
Durable pencils with long lasting core provide bright colors and resist fading
3.3mm break resistant core holds up under pressure
Real wood casing ensures consistent, easy sharpening
Includes 72 brilliant colors, AP certified non-toxic

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,367 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
